input_text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to clean a computer monitor?
input_text.Response A:
Turn off and unplug the monitor.
Clean the frame.
Wipe the monitor with a clean, soft piece of fabric.
Do not use ammonia, alcohol or acetone-based products.
Consider using screen wipes.
For stubborn stains, gently wipe the spot on the screen moving in as broad a motion as you can either left to right or up and down across the screen.
Make sure everything is dry before turning on your monitor.
Check your warranty.
Buy a scratch repair kit.
Try petroleum jelly for a temporary fix.
Use a bit of toothpaste to buff out the scratch.
Use baking soda to buff out the scratch.
Try rubbing compound for severe scratches.
Use clear lacquer.
Know that these methods are to be used at your own risk, and may damage your screen.
Consider investing in a screen protector to prevent future scratches.
input_text.Response B: Sure, I can help you with that!  I can tell you how to clean a computer monitor, and also what you should do if you want to keep your monitor clean.  First of all, you want to make sure you’re using a non-toxic cleaning solution, like vinegar.  You want to make sure you’re not using anything too harsh, and also you want to make sure you’re not using anything that could damage the screen.  You want to make sure you’re not using anything too harsh on the screen itself, and also you want to make sure you’re not using anything that could damage the screen over time. label_annotations.feedback: Response A has good advice, it should just be laid out better. Response B has bad advice as well as being written poorly.
